fields.summary: Firefox version: 3.0.3 Operating system: Windows XP

fields.description: When the mouse pointer hovers over the flash player, mouse wheel does not scroll until the pointer is outside the player. If I click in the player, I have to click outside before I can scroll again.
fields.title: Firefox stops scrolling when mouse is over (some) Flash players
fields.data:
When the mouse pointer hovers over the flash player, mouse wheel does not scroll until the pointer is outside the player. If I click in the player, I have to click outside before I can scroll again.

First it only happened with some versions of JW Player... Now it also happens with all YouTube players.

      Â· Adobe Flash Player (Shockwave Flash, as listed at FF Plugins) 9.0 r124.
      Â· Firefox 3.0, Windows XP SP3, standard mouse.
      * It doesn't affect IE, Safari or Flock.
      * It happens in safe mode.
      * It also happens with FF 3.1 Alpha 1 and FF Portable 3.0, but NOT with FF Portable 2.0.
      Â· I have already uninstalled/reinstalled Flash 9.0.
      Â· I have also tried uninstalling Flash 9 and installing 10 Beta. It didn't work, so now it's 9 again.
      Â· I don't know why the YouTube behavior changed. This morning it started occuring in embedded players; this evening all players were affected.
      Â· Also, the need to click outside before scrolling did only appear after I re-installed Flash.
      Â· I didn't tamper (much) with my system yesterday.
      Â· Google tells me it was a classic bug of FF2 in Linux, solved with FF3. I didn't find anybody with this problem on Windows.

!! Extensions installed: 

Greasemonkey, Stylish, Adblock Plus, etc., but AFAIK safe mode rules them out...

!! Plugins installed: 

*-IE Tab Plug-in for Mozilla/Firefox
*Default Plug-in
*npdivxplayerplugin
*DivX Web Player version 1.4.0.233

fields.description: I have not yet installed Firefox 3, because of its design. I would very much like to be able to make FF 3 look exactly like FF 2, including the separator line between the menubar and the navigation ba
fields.title: Default theme
fields.data:
I have not yet installed Firefox 3, because of its design. I would very much like to be able to make FF 3 look exactly like FF 2, including the separator line between the menubar and the navigation bar which is missing in FF3 (yes, I must be mad), and the default icons/buttons in FF2. Is there a way to make this happen?

fields.description: When I use the Address bar to search for something (eg gmail)  it goes to www.quickbrowsersearch.com which is a useless search engine.  My computer at work searches though google when I do the same th
fields.title: Searching from the address bar results in www.quickbrowsersearch.com
fields.data:
When I use the Address bar to search for something (eg gmail)  it goes to www.quickbrowsersearch.com which is a useless search engine.  My computer at work searches though google when I do the same thing.  I can't figure out why it does this.  So annoying!

fields.description: I'm using the Linux version of Firefox.  When I use the Ctrl+W shortcut to close a tab, if and only if there happens to be exactly one tab, it doesn't just close the tab, but quits the entir
fields.title: Making Ctrl+W close the tab and only close the tab
fields.data:
I'm using the Linux version of Firefox.  When I use the Ctrl+W
shortcut to close a tab, if and only if there happens to be exactly
one tab, it doesn't just close the tab, but quits the entire browser.
I find this highly illogical and inconvenient - it means I have to count
my tabs every time I want to close one in order to make sure I don't
accidentally quit my browser!  Is there any way to fix this?

!! Extensions installed: 

Firebug

fields.description: I have tried adding a bookmark at the top but was unable to seperate the book marks into seperate listsings.   I want a bookmark for ceratain things and another for the rest.   Thanks, Steve To organi
fields.title: Can you have more that one bookmark on Firefox and seperate your bookmarked items
fields.data:
I have tried adding a bookmark at the top but was unable to seperate the book marks into seperate listsings.

I want a bookmark for ceratain things and another for the rest.

Thanks,
Steve
